text.p: Italian insurance group Generali said on Monday its net consolidated attributable profit rose to 1.437 trillion lire from 695 billion lire in 1995.

The parent company announced an unchanged dividend per ordinary share of 375 lire/share for 1996, which taking into account a free capital issue, saw the total company's dividend payout increase 10 percent.

A Generali statement after a group board meeting said that even without proceeds from the sale of Generali's stake in French insurer AXA, group consolidated profit from 1996 would have been 880 billion lire, an increase of 14.3 percent.

The group said that 1996 overall premiums rose 10.7 percent to 34.924 trillion lire, of which some 30.1 percent came from the Italian market. Group investments rose 15 percent to 121.700 trillion lire.
The group said that its operating profit in 1996 was 1.187 trillion lire after 1.041 trillion lire in 1995.
At the parent company level, net profits in 1997 rose to 519.7 billion lire, some 37 billion lire above 1995.
